dt: {bc}an interest or estate in property that follows and is dependent on the termination of a prior intervening possessory estate created at the same time by the same instrument
{bc}the final undivided part after division that is less or of lower degree than the divisor
{bc}a book sold at a reduced price by the publisher after sales have slowed

et: Middle English, from Anglo-French, from {it}remaindre{/it}, verb
shortdef: an interest or estate in property that follows and is dependent on the termination of a prior intervening possessory estate created at the same time by the same instrument
a remaining group, part, or trace
the number left after a subtraction
